page.title: 11SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: SOCIAL CONCERNS - Roslin community council wanted to buy an electric wheelchair for a disabled person.They had a party and a dance and a raffle and raised Â£800.Next was a pet show , it was a great fun day and it made Â£160 .The school collected Â£73 in halfpences and the chess club had a sponsored simultaneous display which made Â£130.There ware sponsored cycles, sales and concerts.By June 1984 they had Â£1900.They bought a chair for Â£1400 but kept on collecting as money was still coming in.In April 1985 there was enough to buy another chair. Bilston Burn winds through Bilston.In 1984 it overflowed and a small girl drowned.The local councillor has begun a campaign to culvert the burn to prevent another accident.
